page.title: 19THE RIVER CLWYD.
page.content: The rods on this part of the River belong to one estate,and is not fished extensively as access is difficult.One small section is let to{Denbigh {Angling Club}.Fish found in the river include{native brown,&migratory sea {trout,eels,small flounders &salmon}. .The salmon found in the area is 2-3yrs.and at the salmon smolt stage on its way back to the sea.{Birdlife includes dippers,wagtails & kingfishers,& problem birds like heron & cormorants. There are unconfirmed reports of Otter and plenty of water voles & moorhens. A water bailiff is employed to look after fish & guard against poachers. Trees and river banks are maintained by the land drainage dept. of the water authority. Willows and alders are usually planted because they grow rapidly.
